JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS WEDNESDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2017/14TH POUSHA, 1938 Crl.MC.No. 7761 of 2016 () AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CMP 2125/2012 of ADDL.C.J.M. (E&0O), ERNAKULAM AGAINST .R.NO.1/2012 OF DRI, CALICUT. PETITIONER (S) /ACCUSED. : CHAKKU PARAMBATH ABDUL SAAHIR S/O ABDULLA CHAKKU, PARAMBATH, AGED 31 YEARS, JANNATH HOUSE, MEPPAYUR PO, VIA VADAKARA, KOZHIKODE DISTRICT. BY ADV. SRI.V.N.RAMESAN NAMBISAN RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANT. : THE SENIOR INTELLIGENCE OFFICER DIRECTORATE OF REVENUE INTELLIGENCE, KOZHIKODE, PIN - 673 001. BY ADV. SRI.S.MANU, CGC, DIRECTORATE OF REVENUE INTELLIGENCE KERALA THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04-01-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Oberst o| Pee 30 ere Taaee ees iz tan 2017/KER/237 Crl.MC.No. 7761 of 2016 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE 1 TRUE COPY OF ORDER DATED 6.7.2012 OF THE COURT OF THE ADDITIONAL CHIEF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE (EO) ERNAKULAM IN CMP NO.2125 OF 2012 IN DRI, KOZHIKODE. ANNEXURE 2 TRUE COPY OF THE ORDER OF THE HON'BLE COURT DATED 28.6.2013 IN CRL.M.C NO.2644 OF 2013. RESPONDENT (S)' EXHIBITS : NIL /TRUE COPY/ P. A. TO JUDGE Pn ees 2017/KER/237 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Dated this the 4" day of January, 2017 ORDER The petitioner herein is the accused in O.R.No.1/2012 of DRI, Calicut for offence punishable under Section 135 of the Customs Act, 1962. In the above case, the allegation was that, the petitioner herein had transported to India 3.5 kgs of gold from abroad. He was granted bail by Annexure 1 order inter alia on a condition that the original passport of the accused shall not be released by the DRI till the trial is over. Subsequently by an order of this Court in Crl.M.C. No.2644/2013, a copy of which is produced as Annexure 2, this Court reiterated that the passport cannot be released, since using the very same passport he had illegally imported 3.5 kgs of gold to India. The matter is still pending before Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate (E.O), Ernakulam. Hence, | feel that time is not ripe for releasing the passport. Crl.M.C. fails and is dismissed. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS, JUDGE. Pn
